oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cayce Homes Administration Building Corner Stone, 1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of worker sealing the corner stone of the administration building for the James A. Cayce Homes (Project Tenn. 5-1) in East Nashville. The Cayce Homes were built between 1939 and 1941 as an white-only community, designed by Marr & Holman. The Administration Service Building is designed in the Classic Revival architectural style, and it was completed in 1943. The building was home to the Nashville Housing Authority, and it was added to the National Register of Historic Places listings in Davidson County, Tennessee in 2019. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority, 1942. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.);
